definitions.definition: The characteristic of being reciprocal, e.g. of a relationship between people.
definitions.example: In a friendship, reciprocity occurs where the contribution of each party meets the expectations of the other party.

definitions.definition: A relation of mutual dependence or action or influence.
(grammar) A reciprocal construction involves two noun phrases where each of the participants occupies both the role of agent and patient with respect to the other. see: Wikipedia:Reciprocal pronoun.
The mutual exchange of rights, privileges or obligations between nations. see: Wikipedia:Reciprocity (international relations).
The responses of individuals to the actions of others.
